content.text: Mororon is the queen of the Tajine Kingdom.

Mororon is a slender and regal-looking woman with teal eyes. Her pale blonde hair is gathered in an updo with sidelocks that curl at her cheeks and a thinner lock of hair on each side of her face that reach pass her shoulders.

She wears a form-fitting blue kaftan dress with dotted pale blue borders as well as wears pink lipstick and nail polish. She also wears a gold tiara shaped like three rectangles, gold hoop earrings, a pink sash around her neck, a tiny red-beaded necklace, and two lilac bracelets on her left wrist. She held a filled red wine glass in each hand during her introduction.
Mororon appears to be a jovial woman, as she made a toast to the people watching her. She appears to like drinking, as she was carrying a glass of wine while heading to the Levely.
As queen of the Tajine Kingdom, Mororon has control over its citizens and is able to attend Levely.
Mororon arrived at the Red Port to attend the Levely at Mary Geoise, and toasted her onlookers. After reaching the top of the Red Line via a bondola, Mororon made her way to the Mary Geoise castle.
The kings and queens later gathered inside the conference room to begin the Levely.

elements.text: Mororon and the Tajine kingdom seem to be inspired by Morocco. Mororon contains the first two syllables of Morocco, and Tajine is a famous Moroccan and Maghrebi dish. The kaftan Mororon wears are traditional Moroccan and Maghrebi robes.
Morocco is famed globally for its red wine and the city Casablanca, the setting of the film of the same name. In her introduction, Mororon quotes a line from Casablanca while drinking red wine.
Mororon wears a traditional robe called the kaftan, which Moroccan women wear on special occasions, and her bodyguards wear the djellaba, traditional clothes of Moroccan men.
↑  One Piece Manga and Anime — Vol. 90 Chapter 905 (p. 6) and Episode 882, Mororon makes her debut.
